title: Ajit Pai
added: In July 2018, the FCC under Pai ordered that the proposed Sinclair-Tribune merger be subject to administrative law judge hearings, due to allegations that Sinclair was planning to illegally retain control of stations it was divesting from. For this action, the FCC was criticized by President Trump, who said he wanted a merged company providing a "conservative voice".<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gold |first1=Hadas |title=Trump slams his own administration's actions on Sinclair-Tribune deal |url=https://money.cnn.com/2018/07/25/media/trump-tweet-sinclair-tribune-fcc/index.html |access-date=January 24, 2021 |work=[[CNN]] |date=July 25, 2018}}</ref> In August 2018, Tribune broke off the merger.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gold |first1=Hadas |last2=Riley |first2=Charles |title=Tribune calls off $3.9 billion Sinclair media deal |url=https://money.cnn.com/2018/08/09/media/tribune-sinclair/index.html |access-date=January 24, 2021 |work=[[CNN]] |date=August 9, 2018}}</ref>
